sen.j: 従二位（じゅにい）は、日本の位階及び神階における位の一つ。
sen.e: Junii (Junior Second Rank) was a rank in court ranks and shinkai (ranks granted to Shinto gods) in Japan.

sen.j: 戦国時代に入ると、武士の官途を担っていた室町幕府の統制が崩れ、次第に有力大名が時下に朝廷に献金し猟官運動を行うことが盛んになり、西国一の有力守護大内義隆が従二位に叙せられる異例の叙位がなされている。
sen.e: As the Sengoku Period (the Period of Warring States) started, the regulation of the Muromachi bakufu which had been responsible for conferring ranks and titles collapsed, then gradually powerful daimyo (Japanese feudal load) actively contributed money directly to the Imperial Court to seek office, resulting in an unprecedented appointment that Yoshitaka OUCHI, the most powerful shugo daimyo (Japanese territorial load as provincial constable), was granted junii.

sen.j: さらに、豊臣秀吉が関白宣下を受けて以降、次第に有力な一門や家臣が従二位に昇り、二位以上に昇る武士も登場するようになった。
sen.e: Furthermore, since Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI had got imperial proclamation to become kanpaku (chief advisor to the Emperor), powerful families and their vassals promoted to junii, some samurai got ranks as high as equal to or higher than nii (Second Rank).
